title: What's News: World-Wide — WSJ
text:
This article is being republished as part of our daily reproduction of WSJ.com articles that also appeared in the U.S. print edition of The Wall Street Journal (October 8, 2019).

Trump's latest move to end U.S. involvement in Syria drew a burst of condemnation from dedicated supporters, who warned that abandoning the Kurds and walking away from the fight against ISIS would cause irreparable damage to U.S. interests.

A judge ruled Trump's accounting firm must turn over eight years of his tax returns, an order immediately put on hold by an appeals court.

House panels subpoenaed the Pentagon and the OMB for documents related to the Trump administration's dealings with Ukraine.

Iraqi leaders moved to stop the use of deadly force against protesters and promised new social aid in an effort to calm demonstrations.

Egypt is combining cyberattacks with random searches of phones and laptops on the street as part of a bid to thwart online dissent.

Sanders's heart attack is bringing to the forefront the issue of the age of the Democratic Party's three leading presidential candidates.

USA Gymnastics made several transfers of millions of dollars into a closely linked foundation in the years before legal challenges triggered a bankruptcy filing.

Businesses would more easily be able to require workers to share tips under a proposal released by the Labor Department.

A trio of U.S. and British scientists won the Nobel Prize in medicine.

(END) Dow Jones Newswires

October 08, 2019 02:47 ET (06:47 GMT)
